scenarios.title: Proportional Response
scenarios.description: A small pirate craft fires warning shots while attempting to flee with contraband. You must decide how to use ship weapons to stop them while minimizing harm to nearby traffic.
options: Return fire with disabling shots aimed at engines.
Fire warning shots back and hold position.
Lock weapons and pursue for a boarding action instead.
Escalate to maximum force to stop them quickly.
Attempt to hail and offer surrender terms first.

scenarios.title: Target Discrimination in Traffic
scenarios.description: Multiple contacts are in a crowded sector; one behaves aggressively. Choose how to apply shipboard weaponry to neutralize the threat without collateral damage.
options: Use a focused disabling torpedo on the hostile contact only.
Bring full weapons to bear on the largest apparent threat.
Hold fire and attempt visual identification before engaging.
Order area-effect fire to ensure neutralization.
Shadow and maintain position until positive ID is achieved.

scenarios.title: Rules of Engagement with Neutral Convoy
scenarios.description: In a simulated escalation, enemy fire begins while a neutral convoy passes nearby. How do you employ ship weapons?
options: Adjust firing arcs to avoid the convoy and return precision fire.
Cease fire until convoy clears, risking further hits.
Fire unrestricted to eliminate the threat immediately.
Request permission to use area-effect ordnance from command.
Use evasive maneuvers and let allied ships engage instead.

scenarios.title: Coordinated Strike to Minimize Damage
scenarios.description: Your task group must disable a fortified target near civilian infrastructure. Decide how to coordinate weapons use across the group.
options: Assign a single lead ship to perform a precision strike pattern.
Allow each ship to engage independently as they see fit.
Use synchronized volleys to overwhelm defenses quickly.
Hold fire and attempt to capture kinetically rather than destroy.
Concentrate a torpedo salvo from one ship to limit collateral effects.

scenarios.title: Non-Lethal Disabling
scenarios.description: An unarmed freighter refuses boarding and attempts to flee. You must use ship weapons to stop it without causing loss of life.
options: Fire precise disabling shots at engines and comms.
Engage tractor beams to stop and hold the freighter.
Target life-support systems to force surrender (extreme measure).
Send boarding party to perform a non-lethal takedown.
Allow the freighter to escape and log the incident for investigation.

scenarios.title: Authorized Use Under Fire
scenarios.description: During an away mission, a hostile combatant opens fire on your squad. You must decide how a cadet should employ their issued phaser.
options: Switch to stun setting and neutralize the attacker.
Use lethal setting to stop the threat immediately.
Take cover and coordinate with squad for a non-lethal takedown.
Disengage and fall back to a safer location.
Attempt to disable the attacker’s weapon with a targeted shot.

scenarios.title: Graduated Force
scenarios.description: A suspect resists arrest but is not actively lethal. Choose the appropriate personal-weapon response consistent with Federation use-of-force principles.
options: Employ stun pulses to incapacitate temporarily.
Warn then use escalating pulse intensity if resistance continues.
Use lethal force immediately to ensure control.
Use non-firearm restraints and call for backup.
Attempt negotiation and de-escalation before firing.

scenarios.title: Ambush Reaction
scenarios.description: Your team is ambushed in a narrow corridor. How should cadets employ their sidearms to maximize team survival?
options: Choke-point suppressive stun fire while breaching.
Attempt to flank using hand signals and coordinated shots.
Retreat in disorder and fire indiscriminately.
Drop weapons and attempt to hide peacefully.
Use aimed lethal shots at obvious hostile combatants only.

scenarios.title: Non-Lethal Apprehension
scenarios.description: A dangerous but surrender-capable target is cornered. You must use personal weapons to subdue without permanent harm.
options: Employ targeted stun to immobilize.
Fire at weapon to disable it rather than the person.
Use entanglement devices (net or restrainer) if available.
Attempt a close-quarters takedown to avoid firing.
Order team to stand down and attempt verbal compliance.

scenarios.title: Weapon Retention Under Threat
scenarios.description: An assailant attempts to wrest your sidearm during a scuffle. How should cadets use their weapon and training to retain it safely?
options: Execute retention maneuver and apply a disabling stun at close range.
Drop the weapon and continue with hand-to-hand techniques.
Fire a warning shot to create distance.
Surrender weapon to avoid escalation.
Attempt to flee while keeping hold of the weapon.

scenarios.title: Ambush Response
scenarios.description: Your squad is ambushed in an urban holosim. Demonstrate tactical use of team formation and weapons to regain initiative.
options: Execute suppression and coordinated flank to neutralize ambushers.
Hold position and call for reinforcements while returning controlled fire.
Break contact and fall back to a defensible position.
Attempt to negotiate a temporary ceasefire.
Use smoke/obscurants and perform stealth extraction.

scenarios.title: Boarding Counter-Tactics
scenarios.description: Hostile boarders are attempting to control critical ship systems. Choose tactical options for countering boarders using available gear and weapons.
options: Seal bulkheads and engage boarders with focused stun fire.
Deploy counter-boarding team to reclaim the area.
Use area non-lethal dispersal (gas/ion) to incapacitate intruders.
Open vents to depressurize the corridor as deterrent (last resort).
Attempt to outmaneuver them and retake from another access point.

scenarios.title: Stealth Night Ops
scenarios.description: A night-time infiltration requires silent movement and precise, non-lethal use of equipment.
options: Use electro-stunners and silent takedowns to avoid detection.
Abort mission due to high risk.
Use ranged tranquilizers to maintain distance.
Rely on tech (drones) instead of personal engagement.
Proceed noisily to draw defenders away from primary objective.

scenarios.title: Joint Ops with Medical
scenarios.description: Tactical teams must secure a mass-casualty zone while minimizing further injuries. How do you employ tactics and weapons use?
options: Secure perimeter then allow medics in while providing overwatch with non-lethal suppression.
Neutralize all perceived threats before permitting medical entry.
Embed medics inside tactical teams for immediate triage under fire.
Use remote suppression to eliminate threats from a distance.
Withdraw and let medical teams operate independently.

scenarios.title: ROE Adherence Under Pressure
scenarios.description: Under provocation, you're ordered to hold fire. How should cadets use weapons responsibly while obeying ROE?
options: Follow ROE strictly and use non-lethal options where possible.
Disobey and neutralize threat immediately.
Attempt capture with minimal force while documenting everything.
Withdraw to avoid escalation and report provocations.
Hold position and seek clarification while maintaining defensive posture.

scenarios.title: Close-Quarters Subdual
scenarios.description: You must clear a corridor and subdue multiple hostile opponents without using energy weapons.
options: Employ coordinated non-lethal takedowns using holds and restraints.
Use improvised blunt instruments to incapacitate quickly.
Push through and avoid engagement if possible.
Attempt to isolate and engage one opponent at a time.
Call for ranged support to break the engagement.

scenarios.title: Defensive Escape
scenarios.description: A larger assailant grabs you in a close fight — use hand-to-hand techniques to escape and disable the threat.
options: Execute practiced escape-and-redirect maneuver and disengage.
Strike to incapacitate and follow with restraint.
Feign compliance to create an opening for counterattack.
Attempt to break the hold and run.
Surrender to avoid injury.

scenarios.title: Non-Lethal Crowd Control
scenarios.description: A panicked crowd threatens to become violent. Use hand-to-hand and team tactics to de-escalate and protect civilians.
options: Form containment lines and use non-lethal holds to isolate aggressors.
Use forceful suppression to disperse the crowd quickly.
Withdraw and call reinforcements.
Use calming announcements and physical guidance to move crowd safely.
Employ incapacitating darts to remove threats.

scenarios.title: Weaponless Disarm
scenarios.description: An opponent tries to disarm you; employ hand-to-hand to retain control and neutralize them without a weapon.
options: Perform retention and disarm technique and restrain.
Drop weapon and use holds to incapacitate.
Attempt to flee and create distance.
Throw a joint lock and call for backup.
Use a disabling choke to end confrontation quickly.

scenarios.title: Precision Hostage Rescue
scenarios.description: You must enter a confined space to free a hostage using close-combat techniques without harming the hostage.
options: Use precision entry, immediate restraint, and controlled holds.
Breach loudly to disorient captors and force compliance.
Negotiate release while tactical team readies non-lethal options.
Use deceptive maneuver to distract captors and extract hostage.
Abort operation until more resources arrive.

scenarios.title: Forensic Use of Surveillance
scenarios.description: Surveillance footage hints at illicit activity. Choose how to use surveillance and investigation tools to confirm and act.
options: Forensically analyze footage, cross-check logs, and identify suspects.
Publicly accuse the suspect immediately based on circumstantial footage.
Ignore until more obvious proof appears.
Deploy covert tracking to gather further evidence.
Shut down surveillance to avoid privacy concerns.

scenarios.title: Covert Shadowing
scenarios.description: You must tail a suspect through a crowded port without detection to observe rendezvous and actions.
options: Maintain discreet distance and document behavior for later action.
Confront suspect immediately to force a reaction.
Lose the tail and attempt to pick them up later using tech.
Employ surveillance drones to shadow remotely and collect evidence.
Call in an overt tactical stop to apprehend quickly.

scenarios.title: Sensor-Based Sting
scenarios.description: Sensor anomalies indicate tampering with freight manifests. Use surveillance and investigation methods to catch the perpetrator in the act.
options: Set a monitored bait shipment and observe via covert sensors.
Publicly accuse cargo personnel to pressure confession.
Replace cargo with decoy and watch who accesses it.
Log anomalies and wait for larger pattern before acting.
Disable cargo access until full audit is complete.

scenarios.title: Undercover Interaction for Evidence
scenarios.description: You must pose as a civilian to collect evidence at a suspect meeting. Use tradecraft and surveillance to safely collect admissible evidence.
options: Adopt a deep cover identity and gather direct evidence while recording covertly.
Approach suspects overtly and attempt to extract information quickly.
Rely only on remote surveillance tech to avoid personal risk.
Plant false information to test responses and reveal collaborators.
Refuse undercover role and request a tech-based sting instead.

scenarios.title: Tracing a Data Leak
scenarios.description: Classified materials are leaking from within the Academy. Choose investigative techniques to locate the source while preserving chain-of-evidence.
options: Correlate access logs, device signatures, and physical movements to identify leaks.
Publicly accuse the most likely suspect as a deterrent.
Shut down network to stop further leaks immediately.
Monitor suspects covertly and collect incriminating data before acting.
Ignore until higher command mandates action.
